intro: Celmisia spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed celmisia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming growth habit and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, showy blue or violet flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
